basics.name: Ian Cone
basics.label: Computational Neuroscientist
basics.summary: A computational neuroscientist specializing in theoretical frameworks of learning and memory, with expertise in behavioral timescale synaptic plasticity, reinforcement learning, and neural network modeling. Currently investigating credit assignment mechanisms in the hippocampus.

work.name: University of Oxford, Costa Lab
work.summary: Investigating the role of hippocampal behavioral timescale plasticity (BTSP) in credit assignment using analytical and computational approaches.
highlights: Developed generalized BTSP model (gBTSP) with analytical solutions for optimal plateau potential distributions
Integrated BTSP into burst-related theories of plasticity (burstprop, burstCCN)

work.name: Imperial College London, Clopath Lab
work.summary: Developed mechanistic theories of learning and memory formation in hippocampal networks.
highlights: Created closed-loop model for context-sensitive feature learning via BTSP
Developed FLEX theory for plastic temporal bases in reinforcement learning

work.name: UTHealth, Shouval Lab
work.summary: Investigated theoretical basis of learning and memory through biophysically realistic neural network modeling.
highlights: Designed modular network for cortical sequence learning and recall
Modeled BTSP formation of place cells with analytically solvable fixed points

work.name: Rice University
work.position: Lead Teaching Assistant - Theoretical Neuroscience I and II
work.summary: Instructed undergraduate and graduate students through office hours, recitation sections, and grading for advanced theoretical neuroscience courses.

work.name: Rice University, Robinson Lab
work.summary: Investigated plasticity in neural networks of Hydra vulgaris using microfluidic assays.

work.name: University of San Francisco, Foreman Lab
work.summary: Created and studied femtosecond electron pulses for ultrafast imaging applications.
highlights: Built and characterized mode-locking femtosecond pulsed Erbium fiber laser

awards.title: Travel Award, Smalley-Curl Transdisciplinary Research Symposium
awards.summary: Awarded to the best presenter during the SCI Transdisciplinary Research Symposium

awards.title: Dr. Raymond Genolio Award
awards.summary: The University of San Francisco's award for top performing graduate in the physical sciences

awards.title: Research Fellowship in the Sciences
awards.summary: The University of San Francisco's summer fellowship for continued research excellence

publications.name: Credit Assignment via Behavioral Timescale Synaptic Plasticity: Theoretical Frameworks
publications.summary: Theoretical framework for understanding credit assignment through behavioral timescale synaptic plasticity mechanisms.

publications.name: Learning to express reward prediction error-like dopaminergic activity requires plastic representations of time
publications.summary: Demonstrates how plastic temporal representations enable learning of dopaminergic reward prediction errors. Published in Nat Commun 15, 5856 (2024).

publications.name: Latent Representations in Hippocampal Network Model Co-Evolve with Behavioral Exploration of Task Structure
publications.summary: Shows how hippocampal representations develop alongside behavioral exploration in structured tasks. Published in Nat Commun 15, 687 (2024).

publications.name: Learning precise spatiotemporal sequences via biophysically realistic learning rules in a modular, spiking network
publications.summary: Presents a biophysically realistic model for learning spatiotemporal sequences in cortical networks. Published in eLife 10, e63751 (2021).

publications.name: Behavioral Time Scale Plasticity of Place Fields: Mathematical Analysis
publications.summary: Mathematical analysis of behavioral timescale plasticity in hippocampal place cells. Published in Front. Comput. Neurosci. 15 (2021).

publications.name: Evolution of Metastable Defects and its Effect on the Electronic Properties of MoS2 Films
publications.summary: Study of defect evolution in MoS2 films and their impact on electronic properties. Published in Scientific Reports 8(1), 6724 (2018).

projects.name: Behavioral Timescale Synaptic Plasticity Framework
projects.summary: Developing theoretical frameworks for understanding how BTSP enables credit assignment in neural circuits, with applications to both neuroscience and AI.

projects.name: Flexibly Learned Error Representations (FLEX)
projects.summary: A mechanistic theory showing how temporal bases for reinforcement learning develop specifically for rewarded stimuli, enabling flexible reward prediction.
